The Book Review PodcastHari Kunzru and Ben Macintyre on their new books.
Since a Sept. 26 celebration for Judge Amy Coney Barrett, at least seven attendees have tested positive for the virus.
With his political career and reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
Dr. Sean Conley, who was appointed as President Trump’s physician in 2018, has served as an emergency doctor for the U.S. Navy since 2006.
The number of new U.S. cases has been slowly rising. Here is where the country is now.

New Supreme Court Term Could End Roberts’s Dominant RoleThe addition of Judge Amy Coney Barrett could create “the Trump court,” pushing it rightward. Cases on Obamacare and gay rights could offer clues.
Where the Trump Campaign Goes From Here With a Month LeftA campaign whose fund-raising, events and messaging have all been driven by President Trump says it will stay the course.
For Veterans, Bonds Forged in Battle Are Tested in 2020Toxic rhetoric and political polarization are driving apart Marines who had one another’s backs through wars and the stresses of civilian life.

Fearing 2nd Wave, N.Y.C. Will Adopt Restrictions in Hard-Hit Areas“Today, unfortunately, is not a day for celebration,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said. His plan would affect 20 neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Queens.
A Special Episode From ‘The Daily’: One Million Lives LostListen as we remember the people who died from the coronavirus, through those who loved them.
Identify the Different Symptoms of the Flu and Covid-19With fears of a “twindemic” in the United States this fall, we offer a guide to understanding what’s making you feel terrible.

President Trump’s fluctuating oxygen levels and a decision to begin treatment with a steroid drug suggested to many experts that his condition is serious.The drug, dexamethasone, is reserved for those with severe illness and has not been shown to benefit those with milder forms of Covid-19.
With his political career and reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
Joe Biden again tested negative for the virus, but his team has kept his safety protocols largely under wraps.
Reporters are fighting for basic facts about President Trump’s health. What should elderly politicians — many of whom are over 80 — reveal about their health?
With President Trump hospitalized, Mark Meadows, his chief of staff, delivered no guidance to aides about how they were expected to behave in a crisis.

President Trump sought to dispel any perception of weakness with a surprise and seemingly risky outing from his hospital bed to greet supporters.Doctors revealed that the president’s oxygen level dropped twice and he had been put on steroids, suggesting his condition might be more serious than initially described.
Many of the measures cited by his doctors are reserved for patients severely affected by the coronavirus.
With his political career and reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
Joe Biden again tested negative for the virus, but his team has kept his safety protocols largely under wraps.
The president is hospitalized and reporters are fighting for basic facts. What should elderly leaders reveal about their health?
Dr. Sean Conley, who admitted that he had misled the public about the president’s treatment, has lost credibility with some colleagues.

President Trump sought to dispel any perception of weakness with a surprise and seemingly risky outing from his hospital bed to greet supporters.Doctors revealed that the president’s oxygen level dropped twice and he had been put on steroids, suggesting his condition might be more serious than initially described.
Many of the measures cited by his doctors are reserved for patients severely affected by the coronavirus.
With his political career and reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
Joe Biden again tested negative for the virus, but his team has kept his safety protocols largely under wraps.
The president is hospitalized and reporters are fighting for basic facts. What should elderly leaders reveal about their health?
Dr. Sean Conley, who admitted that he had misled the public about the president’s treatment, has lost credibility with some colleagues.
With President Trump hospitalized, Mark Meadows delivered no guidance to aides about how they were expected to behave in a crisis.
With virus cases rising, Prime Minister Boris Johnson recently ordered that pubs close at 10 p.m. Andy Rain/EPA, via Shutterstock

Fearing 2nd Wave, N.Y.C. Will Adopt Restrictions in Hard-Hit Areas“Today, unfortunately, is not a day for celebration,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said. His plan would affect 20 neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Queens.
Identify the Different Symptoms of the Flu and Covid-19With fears of a “twindemic” in the United States this fall, we offer a guide to understanding what’s making you feel terrible.

New Supreme Court Term Could End Roberts’s Dominant RoleThe addition of Judge Amy Coney Barrett could create “the Trump court,” pushing it rightward. Cases on Obamacare and gay rights could offer clues.

President Trump sought to dispel any perception of weakness with a surprise and seemingly risky outing from his hospital bed to greet supporters.Doctors revealed that the president’s oxygen level dropped twice and he had been put on steroids, suggesting his condition might be more serious than initially described.
Many of the measures cited by his doctors are reserved for patients severely affected by the coronavirus.
Joe Biden again tested negative for the virus, but his team has kept his safety protocols largely under wraps.
With his political career and reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
The president is hospitalized and reporters are fighting for basic facts. What should elderly leaders reveal about their health?
Dr. Sean Conley, who admitted that he had misled the public about the president’s treatment, has lost credibility with some colleagues.
With President Trump hospitalized, Mark Meadows delivered no guidance to aides about how they were expected to behave in a crisis.
With virus cases rising, Prime Minister Boris Johnson recently ordered that pubs close at 10 p.m. Andy Rain/EPA, via Shutterstock

Fearing 2nd Wave, N.Y.C. Will Adopt Restrictions in Hard-Hit Areas“Today, unfortunately, is not a day for celebration,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said. His plan would affect 20 neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Queens.
Identify the Different Symptoms of the Flu and Covid-19With fears of a “twindemic” in the United States this fall, we offer a guide to understanding what’s making you feel terrible.

New Supreme Court Term Could End Roberts’s Dominant RoleThe addition of Judge Amy Coney Barrett could create “the Trump court,” pushing it rightward. Cases on Obamacare and gay rights could offer clues.
